archimate:Assessment.name: Aki prefers imperfect speedy deliveries
archimate:Assessment.documentation:
Rationale: "Perfection is our worst enemy", "fail fast, learn fast", make improvements as we go along. Speed of delivery trumps quality.
The focus is on delivering items quickly, but the process is acknowledged to be flawed or prone to errors. It suggests that the priority is on speed rather than precision or accuracy, implying that while deliveries are made in a timely manner, they may not meet all the quality standards or expectations.
